      • Map

        public Map()
        Default constructor for Map class

      • Map

        public Map(int x,
           int y)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates the map
        Parameters:
        x - the x-axis size
        y - the y-axis size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the map size is too big (x or y > 50) or too small (x or y < 5)

    • Method Detail

      • setMapSize

        private boolean setMapSize(int x,
                           int y)
        Sets the size of the map.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-axis size
        y - the y-axis size
        Returns:
        true if the map size was set sucessfully, false otherwise

      • generate

        protected void generate()
        Generates the map tiles.

      • checkMapSize

        public static boolean checkMapSize(int mapSize)
        Tests to see if the map size is valid
        Parameters:
        mapSize - the size to check
        Returns:
        true if the size is valid, false if it isn't

      • getMapSize

        public int[] getMapSize()
        Returns:
        An array with the map sizes {x,y}

      • getTileType

        public char getTileType(int x,
                        int y)
                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the tile type at the position specified.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the map
        y - The y coordinate of the map
        Returns:
        'g' if it's a grass tile, 'w' if it's a water tile, 't' if it's a treasure tile, 'u' if the tile is out of bounds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
